weekly_top_story.headline: CMS Launches ACCESS Model to Expand Technology-Supported Chronic Care for Medicare Beneficiaries
weekly_top_story.summary: The Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) initiated the ACCESS Model, a voluntary 10-year program starting July 2026, to test outcome-based payments and enhance care flexibility for chronic conditions in Medicare patients, marking a significant shift toward technology-driven care.

stories.headline: House Passes 5-Year Extension for Medicare’s Acute Hospital-at-Home Funding
stories.summary: The U.S. House of Representatives approved the Hospital Inpatient Services Modernization Act of 2025, extending Medicare’s ability to fund acute hospital-at-home services for five more years, supporting more flexible care delivery post-pandemic.

stories.headline: Shingles Vaccine May Slow Progression of Dementia, New Study Suggests
stories.summary: Recent research indicates the two-dose shingles vaccine not only prevents the viral infection but also could slow dementia progression, potentially impacting aging population care strategies.

stories.headline: Experimental Liver Cancer Vaccine Shows Life-Saving Results in Early Trials
stories.summary: Johns Hopkins researchers report an experimental vaccine that saved lives in early trials targeting a rare liver cancer primarily affecting younger, healthy patients, offering new hope for difficult-to-treat cancers.
